messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder
messages.msgSnippet: I have a tsuba myself with the same kind of rough, crude carving which an exceptionally good authority identified as late Owari. ... From: Richard Turner To:
messages.messageBody:
I have a tsuba myself with the same kind of rough, crude carving which an exceptionally good authority identified as late Owari.

----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 10, 2005 3:31 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder


ahh, Hi David, I see I have done it again, try Hisakata H.01483.0, not
Hisamasa. Here is an identicle one that was signed and sold on Yahoo
Japan recently.

http://img159.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/users/5/3/3/1/kiichikunn-img600x450-1127506997dsc00004-26.jpg

Dimensions are as follows, vegitable tsuba - 67mm 64mm x 5mm

Square tsuba - 66mm x 63mm x 4mm

Yes Owari was also an option I guess, though I think late Owari if it is.

cheers

Rich

David Zincavage wrote:

>1) The leaves look like Aoi to me, and I think they are combined with a gourd which grows around to form the edge in a form reminiscent of Echisen Kinai work. I couldn't see a mei, and I do not find a Hisamasa in Haynes. I think it might be Bushu Ito. They did a lot of Aoi tsuba.
>
>2) Dimensions might help. The corner elements, and the geese, are very abstract. I'd add Owari as a possibility.
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Richard Turner
> To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, October 10, 2005 4:41 AM
> Subject: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder
>
>
> Hisamasa ????
> http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/personal/hisamasa.jpg
>
> Kyo sukashi ??? Shoami ??, also, is this theme bows ( archery ) and
> geese ?. There is toketsu in this one, long and running.
>
> http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/personal/sukashi.jpg
>
> Any thoughts welcome, Cheers
>
> Rich
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder
messages.msgSnippet: Haynes H 01482.0 ca. 1800 Notes: two kanji signature tsuba of rice lants and roots design. Source: Wakayama, Toso Konko Jiten, p. 103, Lower page, 7th section.
messages.messageBody:
Haynes H 01482.0

ca. 1800
Notes: two kanji signature tsuba of rice lants and roots design.
Source: Wakayama, Toso Konko Jiten, p. 103, Lower page, 7th section.
----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 10, 2005 3:31 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder

Japan recently.

http://img159.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/users/5/3/3/1/kiichikunn-img600x450-1127506997dsc00004-26.jpg

Dimensions are as follows, vegitable tsuba - 67mm 64mm x 5mm

Square tsuba - 66mm x 63mm x 4mm

Yes Owari was also an option I guess, though I think late Owari if it is.

cheers

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder
messages.msgSnippet: 1) The leaves look like Aoi to me, and I think they are combined with a gourd which grows around to form the edge in a form reminiscent of Echisen Kinai work.
messages.messageBody:
1) The leaves look like Aoi to me, and I think they are combined with a gourd which grows around to form the edge in a form reminiscent of Echisen Kinai work. I couldn't see a mei, and I do not find a Hisamasa in Haynes. I think it might be Bushu Ito. They did a lot of Aoi tsuba.

2) Dimensions might help. The corner elements, and the geese, are very abstract. I'd add Owari as a possibility.



----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 10, 2005 4:41 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] a couple of tsuba to ponder


Hisamasa ????
http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/personal/hisamasa.jpg

Kyo sukashi ??? Shoami ??, also, is this theme bows ( archery ) and
geese ?. There is toketsu in this one, long and running.

http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/personal/sukashi.jpg

Any thoughts welcome, Cheers

Rich
